GemTargetTypes.Label: Allowed Item Types
GemTargetTypes.Hint: Choose which item subtypes can receive this gem.

GemDetails.Hint: Choose how this gem should be categorized.
GemDetails.Disclaimer: Use the fields below to adjust only the attacks made with the weapon that holds this gem. Active Effects applied to the actor affect every attack with any weapon. For armor and shields, use the gem's standard Active Effects on the item.

ExtraDamage.Label: Extra Damage
ExtraDamage.Hint: Add one or more extra damage entries applied when this gem is socketed into weapons.
ExtraDamage.ActivityHint: Choose when this extra damage applies. Any action: always. Attack only: only on attack-type activities.

CritDamage.Label: Critical-Only Damage
CritDamage.Hint: Damage that only applies when this gem is socketed and you roll critical damage (button or crit action).

CritThreshold.Label: Critical Threshold
CritThreshold.Hint: Lowest d20 result that counts as a critical hit for attacks with this gem socketed. If multiple gems adjust crit, the lowest value is used. Leave blank to use the base weapon value.

CritMultiplier.Label: Critical Multiplier
CritMultiplier.Hint: Multiply critical damage by this value when this gem is socketed. If multiple gems set this, the highest value is used. Leave blank to keep the default multiplier.

AttackBonus.Label: Attack Bonus
AttackBonus.Hint: Flat bonus added to attack rolls when this gem is socketed. Bonuses from multiple gems stack. Leave blank for none.

Tooltips.RemoveGem: Remove the gem from this socket.
Tooltips.DeleteSocket: Delete this slot from the item.

EditPermission.Name: Edit Socket Permission
EditPermission.Hint: The minimum role required to add or remove sockets from items.

MaxSockets.Name: Maximum Number of Sockets per Item
MaxSockets.Hint: Maximum number of sockets an item can have. Use -1 for unlimited.

DeleteOnRemoval.Name: Delete Gem on Removal
DeleteOnRemoval.Hint: If enabled, a gem is destroyed when removed from a socket; otherwise it's returned to the player's inventory.
